Description: Eight small gold discs or beads; made from sheet metal: central boss surrounded by a raised ring in repoussé; two diametrically opposed perforated holes for attachment, possibly to a backing material or else strung into a necklace.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Amathus
Bibliographic references: Jewellery / Catalogue of the Jewellery, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum. (3104)
Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p.118, Tomb 66; pl.XIV, 28)
Laffineur et al. 1986 / Amathonte III. Testimonia 3. L'Orfèvrerie. Scarabées, scaraboïdes et cônes. La coupe en argent du British Museum (No.92, p.29)
